member.name: IContactProperties.CreateArrayNode
member.summary: Creates a new array node in a multi-value property.
member.param: Specifies the top-level property for which to create a new node.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
TRUE for insert after, FALSE for insert before.
Specifies a user-allocated buffer to store the new array element name.
Specifies an allocated buffer size in characters.
On failure, contains the required size for pszNewArrayElementName.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: New node is created and name is in pszNewArrayElementName.
Macro HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND) returned when array name is invalid.

Macro HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER) returned when pszNewArrayElementName is not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in pdwcchNewArrayElementNameRequired.

member.name: IContactProperties.DeleteArrayNode
member.summary: Deletes the data at a specified array entry.
member.param: Specifies array entry from which to remove all data.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Property name doesn't exist for delete.

member.name: IContactProperties.DeleteLabels
member.summary: Deletes the labels at a specified array entry.
member.param: Specifies the property to delete labels on.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Property name doesn't exist for delete.

member.name: IContactProperties.DeleteProperty
member.summary: Deletes the value at a specified property. Property modification and version data can still be enumerated with IContactPropertyCollection.
member.param: Specifies the property to delete the value for.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Property name doesn't exist for delete.

member.name: IContactProperties.GetBinary
member.summary: Retrieves the binary data of a property using an .
member.param: Specifies the property to retrieve.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the MIME content type.
Specifies the allocated buffer size in characters.
On failure, contains the required size for pszContentType.
On success, contains a new . Use this to retrieve the binary data.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: ppStream contains an . Caller must release the reference.

No data for this value. Either the property has been present in the past but its value has been removed or the property is a container of other properties (toplevel/secondlevel[3]). The buffer at pszContentType has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.
Unable to get value for this property due to schema.
pszContentType was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in pdwcchContentTypeRequired.

member.name: IContactProperties.GetDate
member.summary: Retrieves the date and time value at a specified property into a caller's structure. All times are stored and returned as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
member.param: Specifies the property to retrieve.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies caller-allocated structure.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: The property has been present in the past but its value has been removed. The has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.

member.name: IContactProperties.GetLabels
member.summary: Retrieves the labels for a specified array element name.
member.param: Specifies the array element name.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the labels.
Specifies allocated buffer size in characters.
On failure, contains the required size for pszLabels.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: No data found for this property name.
Unable to get value for this property due to schema.
pszLabels was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in *pdwcchLabelsRequired.

member.name: IContactProperties.GetPropertyCollection
member.summary: Returns an IContactPropertyCollection for the current contact. Optionally, filters the IContactPropertyCollection to enumerate only some values.
member.param: On success, points to the new IContactPropertyCollection.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies the name of the collection (for example: emailAddresses or [namespace]arrayNode). If NULL, all collections are searched for ppszLabels.
Specifies the number of labels in ppszLabels. If zero, all subproperties with labels are returned.
Specifies an array of string labels to test for. All labels in the array must be set to a valid string (not NULL).
TRUE if the presence of any label on a given property matches the property. FALSE if all labels must be present to match the property.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

member.name: IContactProperties.GetString
member.summary: Retrieves the string value at a specified property into a caller-allocated buffer.
member.param: Specifies the property to retrieve.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the property.
Specifies allocated buffer size in characters.
On failure, contains the required size for pszValue.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: No data for this value. Either the property has been present in the past but its value has been removed or the property is a container of other properties (toplevel/secondlevel[3]). The buffer at pszValue has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.
pszValue was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in *pdwcchPropertyValueRequired.

member.name: IContactProperties.SetBinary
member.summary: Sets the binary data at a specified property to the contents of a specified , which contains a null-terminated string (as MIME type) data.
member.param: Specifies the property to set.
CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite the value at pszPropertyName.
Specifies null-terminated string representing MIME type to store when CGD_DEFAULT.

Pointer to object containing data to place at this node. NOTE: IStream.Read is called for the data until it succeeds with a zero-length read. Any other return value results in a failure and no change.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Property name is invalid for set, or property name doesn't exist for delete.
Unable to set the value for this property due to schema.

member.name: IContactProperties.SetDate
member.summary: Sets the date and time value at a specified property to a given. All times are stored and returned as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).
member.param: Specifies the property to set.
CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite value at pszPropertyName.
structure to use for date.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value is set at this property.
Unable to set the value for this property due to schema.

member.name: IContactProperties.SetLabels
member.summary: Appends the set of labels passed in to the specified property's label set. Note: This method does not check for duplicate labels.
member.param: Specifies the property to label.
Must be CGD_DEFAULT.
Specifies the count of labels in array.
Specifies an array of LPCWSTR labels.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: No data found for this property name.
Unable to set value for this property due to schema.

member.name: IContactProperties.SetString
member.summary: Sets the string value of a specified property to that of a specified null-terminated string.
member.param: Specifies the property to set.
CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite value at pszPropertyName.
Specifies null-terminated string to store.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value is set at this property.
Unable to set value for this property due to schema.

member.name: IContactProperties
member.summary: Do not use. Used to retrieve, set, create, and remove properties on an IContact. Property names and extension mechanisms are described in icontactproperties.h.
